Package com.jme.bullet.joints

Class PhysicsJoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jme.bullet.joints.PhysicsJoint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.jme.export.Savable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConeJoint, HingeJoint, Point2PointJoint, SixDofJoint, SliderJoint
    public abstract class PhysicsJoint
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.jme.export.Savable
    The abstract base class for physics joints based on Bullet's btTypedConstraint, used to connect 2 dynamic rigid bodies in the same physics space.

    Joints include ConeJoint, HingeJoint, Point2PointJoint, and SixDofJoint.

    Author:
    normenhansen

    • Field Detail

      • objectId

        protected long objectId
        Unique identifier of the Bullet constraint. Constructors are responsible for setting this to a non-zero value. After that, the id never changes.

      • nodeA

        protected PhysicsRigidBody nodeA
        one of the connected rigid bodies

      • nodeB

        protected PhysicsRigidBody nodeB
        the other connected rigid body

      • pivotA

        protected com.jme.math.Vector3f pivotA
        local offset of this joint's connection point in node A

      • pivotB

        protected com.jme.math.Vector3f pivotB
        local offset of this joint's connection point in node B

      • collisionBetweenLinkedBodys

        protected boolean collisionBetweenLinkedBodys

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhysicsJoint

        public PhysicsJoint()
        No-argument constructor needed by SavableClassUtil. Do not invoke directly!

      • PhysicsJoint

        public PhysicsJoint​(PhysicsRigidBody nodeA,
                    PhysicsRigidBody nodeB,
                    com.jme.math.Vector3f pivotA,
                    com.jme.math.Vector3f pivotB)
        Instantiate a PhysicsJoint. To be effective, the joint must be added to the physics space of the two bodies. Also, the bodies must be dynamic and distinct.
        Parameters:
        nodeA - the 1st body connected by the joint (not null, alias created)
        nodeB - the 2nd body connected by the joint (not null, alias created)
        pivotA - local offset of the joint connection point in node A (not null, alias created)
        pivotB - local offset of the joint connection point in node B (not null, alias created)

    • Method Detail

      • getAppliedImpulse

        public float getAppliedImpulse()
        Read the magnitude of the applied impulse.
        Returns:
        impulse

      • getObjectId

        public long getObjectId()
        Read the id of the Bullet constraint.
        Returns:
        the unique identifier (not zero)

      • isCollisionBetweenLinkedBodys

        public boolean isCollisionBetweenLinkedBodys()
        Test whether collisions are allowed between the linked bodies.
        Returns:
        true if collision are allowed, otherwise false

      • setCollisionBetweenLinkedBodys

        public void setCollisionBetweenLinkedBodys​(boolean collisionBetweenLinkedBodys)
        Enable or disable collisions between the linked bodies. The joint must be removed from and added to PhysicsSpace for this change to be effective.
        Parameters:
        collisionBetweenLinkedBodys - true → allow collisions, false → prevent them

      • getBodyA

        public PhysicsRigidBody getBodyA()
        Access the 1st body specified in during construction.
        Returns:
        the pre-existing body

      • getBodyB

        public PhysicsRigidBody getBodyB()
        Access the 2nd body specified in during construction.
        Returns:
        the pre-existing body

        public com.jme.math.Vector3f getPivotA()
        Access the local offset of the joint connection point in node A.
        Returns:
        the pre-existing vector (not null)

      • getPivotB

        public com.jme.math.Vector3f getPivotB()
        Access the local offset of the joint connection point in node A.
        Returns:
        the pre-existing vector (not null)

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Finalize this physics joint just before it is destroyed. Should be invoked only by a subclass or by the garbage collector.
